Question: How can I normalize the EOL character in Java?: :I have a linux server and many clients with many operating systems. The server takes an input file from clients. Linux has end of line char LF, while Mac has end of line char CR, andWindows has end of line char CR+LFThe server needs as end of line char LF. Using java, I want to ensure that the file will always use the linux eol char LF. How can I achieve it?
Please using this api: DataOutputStream.write.
Answer:
response:
Please answer my code questions using the given API following this format: <<<api>>>: $API

Question: How can I normalize the EOL character in Java?: :I have a linux server and many clients with many operating systems. The server takes an input file from clients. Linux has end of line char LF, while Mac has end of line char CR, andWindows has end of line char CR+LFThe server needs as end of line char LF. Using java, I want to ensure that the file will always use the linux eol char LF. How can I achieve it?
Please using this api: DataOutputStream.write.
Answer:
<<<api>>>: DataOutputStream.write
<<<code>>>:
```java
public void write(int b) throws IOException {
    ensureOpen();
    if (b < 0 || b > 255) {
        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Byte out of range: " + b);
    }
    out.write(b);
}
```
<<<explanation>>>:
The write method of DataOutputStream class writes a single byte to the output stream. The byte is the eight low-order bits of the argument b. The 24 high-order bits of b are ignored.
